intro: Gilia triodon, commonly known as the three-toothed gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Gilia triodon is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
